rComments: He uses Frenglish a lot, so be ready to switch languages within your notes. Sitting theough this class three hours at a time is nigh unbearable, unless you like being droned at in those chairs that attach to the table. Highly recommend you check out Munday's "Introducing Translation Studies: Theories and Applications"- prof basically copies it.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Le professeur connait sa matière, mais la façon dont le cours est structuré (principalement de la correction de devoirs) n'est pas très intéressante et n'invite pas à la participation, même si cette dernière est comptée dans la note finale. Le contenu des lectures est souvent hermétique et peu développé en classe, sans explications complémentaires.
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', 'Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Il est très exigent et donne une grande charge de travail. Sa matière n'est pas claire, ses consignes ne sont pas claires et son livre est désuet. On fait pratiquement le cours en devoir et on ne fait rien de nouveau en classe. Il exige la participation ou sinon on perd 10% . Pire cours à vie.
Fascinant. Bien expliqué. Beaucoup de travail pour les étudiants, mais très intéressant. Le prof était toujours bien préparé et savait de quoi il parlait.

You do need to put the work in. 500 to 1000 words to translate per week. Very direct/critical, but helpful if you can take the criticism. The way the course is structured is a bit dumb though. Specialized translation? No. Globalization translation, yes. Interesting stimulating class if you're willing yo work. If not, try high school.

Read and memorize the entire coursepack, because he randomly picks stuff out of it for exams. If your memorization skills are poor (ie: if you do not have autism), then you will not do well in this class. You've got to love his well-trained helper-monkey who changes the slides when he says "oui" (seriously, give your TA something to do).

OMG, the thought of spending three more hours at a time in his class makes me want to cry. Boring beyond belief, aims ill-conceived digs at his students and seems to think that he knows everything and reasons on a higher dimension than the lesser rabble.  Pray you never get him, especially if you're an anglophone...

Boooooooorrring! You know this class is FRIGGING DULL when you'd rather spend three hours sharpening your fingers with an electric pencil sharpener than sit through another translation theory lecture. Ugh.

Always late, so don't bother rushing to class. Boring subject... read from the book all semester along with students. Didn't prepare course before teaching it. Oh yeah, and the book is about 60 years old.
